item1_summary:
Corpay is a global corporate payments company that helps businesses and consumers better manage and pay their expenses . Corpay's suite of modern payment solutions help customers better manage vehicle-related expenses (e.g., fueling, tolls, car registrations and parking), lodging expenses and corporate payments . The company has been a member of the S&P 500 since 2018 .
 Corpay’s vision is that every payment is digital, every purchase is controlled and every related decision is informed . Our wide range of modern, digitized solutions provide control, reporting and automation benefits superior to many of the payment methods businesses often use such as cash, paper checks, credit cards, as well as employee payment processes .
 Corpay facilitates payments to or on behalf of millions of businesses around the world using multiple modalities . Corpay has the following reportable segments: Vehicle Payments, Corporate Payments, Lodging Payments and Other. These segments reflect how we organize and manage our global employee base, manage operating performance and execute on  strategic initiatives.
 Vehicle Payment solutions provide seamless, mobile first digital experience when paying for vehicle related expenses . Vehicle Payments solutions are used by customers to pay and control spending for fuel for vehicles and fleets . Fuel solutions are fuel type agnostic (fossil fuel, electricity, etc.) We offer fuel solutions to businesses and government entities who operate vehicle fleets .
 Many will operate "mixed" fleets (i.e., fleets with a combination of internal combustion vehicles and EVs) for a long period of time . Many will need access to all types of fueling, including networks of fuel fueling stations, electric charging stations both on the road and at the office and at-home charging options .
 Our EV home-charging software solution is aimed at fleets that need to accurately reimburse drivers for business purposes, capturing, measuring and accurately pricing relevant charging sessions . We are actively expanding our EV footprint to accommodate charging in the U.S., U.K. and Europe . Our vehicle OEM partners  include Renault, NIO, Polestar and Jaguar-Land Rover .
 Our tolls solution operates on our proprietary Sem PararTM network, which processes transactions for more than 7.5 million tagholders on 100% of the toll roads  that accept RFID across Brazil . We provide convenience and faster travel for customers, while also reducing manual labor and cash handling at merchants’ toll booths . Our tags may also be used at approximately 7,300 participating merchant locations to purchase goods and services in the vehicle .
 Vehicle management solution helps major leasing companies, as well as fleet operators of all sizes, to manage their vehicle maintenance, service and repair needs . This solution is provided through our proprietary maintenance and repair network, which, in the U.K., processes transactions for fleet customers at approximately 9,000 service centers . In Mexico and Brazil, we offer prepaid food vouchers or cards that may be used as a form of payment in restaurants and grocery stores .
 Corporate Payments solutions help businesses streamline the management, processing and payment of their domestic and international invoices and make point-of-sale purchases for their employees . Companies can save time, reduce costs and manage business-to-business (B2B) payment processing more efficiently with our suite of Corporate Payment solutions, including accounts payable (AP) automation, virtual cards, cross-border payment products and purchasing and T&E cards .
 Virtual Card payment, providing significant reconciliation advantages to ACH and ACH payments, is unique due to the nature of commercial Virtual Card acceptance . We have integrated our Virtual Card offering into most leading ERP systems, providing a seamless experience for our customer's accounts payable personnel . Our Cross-Border solution is used by our customers to pay international vendors, foreign office and  personnel expenses and for profit repatriation and dividends .
 Trade settlement and payment delivery is facilitated through a global network of correspondent banks, in-country payment gateways and technology providers, enabling us to send payments to recipients in over 200 countries and 145 currencies . By utilizing transaction monitoring and "watch list" screening systems, we ensure payments are safe, secure and meet regulatory requirements .
 The size, scale and nature of our lodging customer base enables us to negotiate lodging nightly rates lower than the rates most companies could negotiate directly and below the rates available to the general public . We also can secure hotel rooms outside our proprietary networks in each of our solutions, or private homes in our insurance vertical . Our solution allows customers to find and book lodging online, via app, directly with the hotel or by calling us .
 We offer end-to-end automation of the crew layover process, providing cost-saving hotel and transport bookings . We also have a proactive disruption system managing flight rebookings, meals, compensation and transportation for distressed passengers . We provide temporary housing solutions for displaced policyholders of insurance carriers and catastrophe teams .
 We offer a payroll card solution in North America in the form of a reloadable stored value card, that can be used instead of a paper payroll check . Our solution operates on the Mastercard payment network and the Allpoint ATM network . Our go-to-market strategy includes comprehensive digital channels, direct sales forces and strategic partner relationships .
 With respect to our tolls solution, we also place proprietary manned kiosks and unmanned vending machines in areas with high foot traffic, such as shopping malls, to reach consumers . Third-party distribution is generally provided by other companies, who are reliant on access to our systems to meet their distribution obligations . With both the fraud and credit review, we leverage third-party data sources, including device data, fraud scores and credit bureau data .
 Review includes a combination of machine learning models, as well as judgmental underwriting based on customer financials . We employ a variety of tools to manage risk in our portfolio, including billing frequency, payment terms, spending limits, payment methods and security . We use fraud detection programs, including proprietary and third-party solutions, to monitor transactions and prevent misuse .
 We have strong market positions across four continents . We own and control all the critical components to our offering, creating improved speed to market and proprietary feature functionality in the marketplace . Our growth model historically benefits from strong revenue retention, organic growth from new customer acquisitions and selling more value-added products to current customers, via developed and acquired payment solutions .
 Corpay’s technology provides continuous authorization of transactions, processing of critical account and customer information and settlinglement between merchants, issuing companies and individual commercial entities . This allows Corpay to deliver more consistent financial performance relative to competitors, continue to invest throughout business cycles and reallocate  resources to higher performing businesses .
 Our IT transformation initiatives are focused on three main pillars: (1) digital strategy; (2) core  systems modernization; and (3) data . Cloud-based architecture allows us to maintain, administer and innovate our solutions in a cost-effective and flexible manner . As we develop new solutions and modernize legacy assets, we increasingly use cloud services . Through the use of microservices, we are able to modernize our platforms with no disruption to customers .
 The use of cloud services provides us with increased flexibility and agility . We use only proven technology and expect no foreseeable capacity limitations . We may have responsibility to card networks, financial institutions and in some instances, our customers, and/or  customers, for our failure or the failure of our associated third parties to protect this information .
